home.description: होम लोन, लोन, निवेश, सेवानिवृत्ति और अधिक के लिए हमारे व्यापक वित्तीय कैलकुलेटर संग्रह का अन्वेषण करें।

investmentReturn.title: निवेश रिटर्न कैलकुलेटर
investmentReturn.description: अपने निवेश रिटर्न और ROI की गणना करें। आपने क्या निवेश किया बनाम क्या वापस मिला की तुलना करें।
investmentReturn.totalVsAnnualizedText: कुल रिटर्न आपके समग्र लाभ या हानि को प्रतिशत के रूप में दिखाता है। वार्षिक रिटर्न (CAGR) समतुल्य वार्षिक रिटर्न दर दिखाता है, जो विभिन्न अवधियों के लिए रखे गए निवेशों की तुलना करने के लिए उपयोगी है।
investmentReturn.cagrFormulaDesc: यह आपको स्थिर वार्षिक वृद्धि दर देता है जो आपके प्रारंभिक निवेश को उसके अंतिम मूल्य तक ले जाएगी।
investmentReturn.realEstateReturn: ~8-12% वार्षिक (मूल्य वृद्धि और किराया आय सहित)
investmentReturn.footerDisclaimer: अस्वीकरण: पिछला प्रदर्शन भविष्य के परिणामों की गारंटी नहीं देता। यह कैलकुलेटर केवल शैक्षिक उद्देश्यों के लिए है।
investmentReturn.desc: Calculate ROI and compare different investment scenarios.

mortgage.title: Mortgage Calculator
mortgage.description: Calculate monthly payments, total interest, and view amortization schedule.
mortgage.desc: Calculate monthly payments, total interest, and view amortization schedule.

compoundInterest.title: Compound Interest Calculator
compoundInterest.description: See how your money grows over time with the power of compound interest.
compoundInterest.resourcesDescription: Learn more about investing and growing your wealth:
compoundInterest.articleIntro: Compound interest is often called the "eighth wonder of the world." Unlike simple interest, compound interest earns interest on your interest, creating exponential growth over time.
compoundInterest.howItWorksText: When your investment earns interest, that interest is added to your principal. In the next period, you earn interest on both your original principal AND the previously earned interest. This creates a snowball effect that accelerates your wealth building.
compoundInterest.keyFactors: Key Factors That Affect Your Returns
compoundInterest.factorTime: The longer you invest, the more powerful compounding becomes
compoundInterest.factorRate: Higher rates lead to faster growth
compoundInterest.factorFrequency: More frequent compounding (daily vs yearly) yields slightly higher returns
compoundInterest.factorContributions: Adding money consistently dramatically increases your final balance
compoundInterest.ruleOf72Text: A quick way to estimate how long it takes to double your money: divide 72 by your interest rate. At 7% interest, your money doubles in approximately 10.3 years (72 / 7 = 10.3).
compoundInterest.desc: See how your investments grow over time with compound interest.

retirement.title: Retirement Calculator
retirement.description: Plan your retirement savings and see if you're on track.
retirement.pageDescription: Plan your retirement and see if you're on track to meet your financial goals.
retirement.fourPercentRuleDesc: The 4% rule suggests you can withdraw 4% of your retirement savings annually without running out of money over a 30-year retirement. To find how much you need, multiply your desired annual income by 25.
retirement.factorTime: The earlier you start, the more compound interest works in your favor
retirement.factorContribution: Aim to save 15-20% of your income for retirement
retirement.factorReturns: A diversified portfolio historically returns 6-8% after inflation
retirement.factorSocialSecurity: This calculator doesn't include Social Security benefits, which can supplement your savings
retirement.tip401k: Maximize employer 401(k) matching - it's free money
retirement.tipRoth: Consider a Roth IRA for tax-free growth
retirement.tipIncrease: Increase contributions when you get raises
retirement.tipFees: Keep investment fees low with index funds
retirement.desc: Plan your retirement savings and see if you're on track.

loan.title: Loan Payoff Calculator
loan.description: See how extra payments can help you pay off loans faster.
loan.pageDescription: See how extra payments can help you become debt-free faster and save money on interest.
loan.articleIntro: Making extra payments on your loan goes directly toward your principal balance. This reduces the amount of interest you pay over time and shortens your loan term.
loan.strategiesTitle: Strategies for Paying Off Debt Faster
loan.strategyRoundUpDesc: Round your payment to the nearest $50 or $100
loan.strategyBiWeeklyDesc: Pay half your monthly payment every two weeks (equals 13 monthly payments per year)
loan.strategyLumpSumDesc: Apply tax refunds or bonuses to your principal
loan.strategyRefinanceDesc: If rates have dropped, refinancing could lower your interest rate
loan.consideration1: Check if your loan has prepayment penalties
loan.consideration2: Ensure extra payments are applied to principal, not future payments
loan.consideration3: Consider building an emergency fund before aggressive debt payoff
loan.footerDisclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only. Contact your lender for exact payoff amounts.

debtPayoff.title: Debt Payoff Calculator
debtPayoff.description: Create a personalized debt payoff plan. Compare snowball and avalanche methods to find what works best for you.
debtPayoff.avalanche: Avalanche (Highest Interest First) - Saves Most Money
debtPayoff.avalancheDesc: Pay off debts with the highest interest rate first. This method saves the most money on interest over time.
debtPayoff.snowballDesc: Pay off debts with the smallest balance first. Quick wins keep you motivated, even if you pay slightly more interest.
debtPayoff.avalancheReason: You're motivated by saving money and can stay disciplined
debtPayoff.snowballReason: You need quick wins to stay motivated, or have many small debts
debtPayoff.tip1: Always pay at least the minimum on all debts
debtPayoff.tip2: Put all extra money toward one debt at a time
debtPayoff.tip3: Consider balance transfer cards for high-interest debt
debtPayoff.tip4: Avoid taking on new debt while paying off existing debt
debtPayoff.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only. Actual payoff times may vary based on interest rate changes and payment timing.
debtPayoff.fillAllFields: Please fill in all debt fields
debtPayoff.addAtLeastOne: Please add at least one debt
debtPayoff.desc: Create a debt payoff plan using snowball or avalanche method.

autoLoan.title: Auto Loan Calculator
autoLoan.description: Calculate car loan payments and total cost of financing.
autoLoan.resourcesDescription: Learn about auto financing options and consumer protections:
autoLoan.articleTitle: How to Get the Best Auto Loan
autoLoan.articleIntro: Getting pre-approved for an auto loan before visiting the dealership gives you negotiating power and helps you understand your budget.
autoLoan.tipCreditDesc: Even a small improvement can significantly lower your rate
autoLoan.tipDownPaymentDesc: 20% down is ideal to avoid being "underwater"
autoLoan.tipShopDesc: Compare rates from banks, credit unions, and online lenders
autoLoan.newVsUsed1: New cars typically have lower interest rates but higher prices
autoLoan.newVsUsed2: Used cars depreciate less but may have higher rates
autoLoan.newVsUsed3: Certified pre-owned (CPO) vehicles often offer the best of both worlds
autoLoan.desc: Calculate car loan payments and total cost of financing.

studentLoan.title: Student Loan Calculator
studentLoan.description: Plan your student loan repayment and explore forgiveness options.
studentLoan.pageDescription: Calculate your student loan payments and explore different repayment strategies.
studentLoan.incomeDrivenDesc: Payments based on income (IBR, PAYE, SAVE)
studentLoan.pslfDesc: Forgiveness after 10 years of public service
studentLoan.tip2: Pay more than the minimum when possible
studentLoan.tip3: Consider refinancing for lower rates (but lose federal benefits)
studentLoan.desc: Plan your student loan repayment and explore forgiveness options.

401k.title: 401(k) Calculator
401k.description: Maximize your 401(k) contributions and employer matching.
401k.pageDescription: Calculate how your 401(k) contributions will grow and see the impact of employer matching.
401k.rulesDescription: Stay informed about contribution limits and retirement account rules:
401k.articleIntro: Your 401(k) is one of the most powerful tools for building retirement wealth, especially when your employer offers matching contributions.
401k.employerMatchingText: Employer matching is essentially free money. If your employer matches 50% of contributions up to 6% of your salary, you should contribute at least 6% to get the full match. Not doing so is leaving money on the table.
401k.limit50Plus: 50 and older: Additional $7,500 catch-up contribution allowed
401k.strategyTip1: Choose low-cost index funds when available
401k.strategyTip2: Diversify across stocks, bonds, and international investments
401k.strategyTip3: Consider target-date funds for automatic rebalancing
401k.strategyTip4: Review and rebalance your portfolio annually
401k.footerDisclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only. Actual returns will vary. Consult a financial advisor for personalized retirement planning.

savingsGoal.title: Savings Goal Calculator
savingsGoal.description: Find out how much you need to save each month to reach your financial goal.
savingsGoal.resourcesDescription: Find the best places to grow your savings:
savingsGoal.articleTitle: Tips for Reaching Your Savings Goal
savingsGoal.automateSavingsText: Set up automatic transfers from your checking to savings account right after payday. This "pay yourself first" approach ensures you save before you spend.
savingsGoal.highYieldSavingsDesc: Best for emergency funds and short-term goals
savingsGoal.cdsDesc: Higher rates for money you won't need for a set period
savingsGoal.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates based on constant interest rates. Actual results may vary.
savingsGoal.desc: Find out how much to save monthly to reach your goal.

emergencyFund.title: Emergency Fund Calculator
emergencyFund.description: Calculate how much you need in your emergency fund to protect against unexpected expenses.
emergencyFund.articleTitle: Why You Need an Emergency Fund
emergencyFund.articleIntro: An emergency fund protects you from unexpected expenses like job loss, medical bills, or car repairs without going into debt.
emergencyFund.threeMonthsDesc: Minimum for stable income, dual-income households
emergencyFund.nineToTwelveMonthsDesc: Self-employed, single income, or volatile industry
emergencyFund.whereToKeepTitle: Where to Keep Your Emergency Fund
emergencyFund.whereToKeep1: High-yield savings account (easy access, earns interest)
emergencyFund.whereToKeep3: NOT in investments (too risky for emergency funds)
emergencyFund.desc: Calculate how much you need in your emergency fund.

inflation.title: Inflation Calculator
inflation.description: See how inflation affects your purchasing power over time.
inflation.resourcesDescription: Stay informed about inflation and economic trends:
inflation.articleIntro: Inflation is the rate at which the general level of prices for goods and services rises, causing purchasing power to fall. The Federal Reserve targets 2% annual inflation as healthy for the economy.
inflation.period2020_2023Value: Higher than average due to pandemic effects
inflation.investInStocksDesc: Historically outpace inflation over long periods
inflation.iBondsProtectionDesc: Government bonds that adjust for inflation
inflation.realEstateDesc: Property values often rise with inflation
inflation.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator uses a constant inflation rate. Actual inflation varies year to year.
inflation.desc: See how inflation affects your purchasing power over time.

salary.title: Salary Calculator
salary.description: Convert between hourly, weekly, monthly, and annual salary.
salary.resourcesDescription: Learn about minimum wage laws and employment rights:
salary.articleIntro: Knowing how your salary breaks down across different time periods helps you budget effectively and compare job offers.
salary.salaryVsHourlyDesc: Salaried employees typically receive the same pay regardless of hours worked, while hourly employees are paid for actual hours worked and may receive overtime pay for hours over 40 per week.
salary.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator shows gross pay before taxes and deductions. Actual take-home pay will be lower.
salary.desc: Convert between hourly, weekly, monthly, and annual salary.

takeHomePay.title: Take-Home Pay Calculator
takeHomePay.description: Calculate your net pay after taxes and deductions.
takeHomePay.head: Head of Household
takeHomePay.federalTaxDesc: Based on W-4 and tax brackets
takeHomePay.noStateTaxDesc: These states have no state income tax:
takeHomePay.noStateTaxNote: *No tax on wages; may tax investment income
takeHomePay.federalIncomeTaxDesc: Federal income tax is calculated based on your taxable income and filing status. The U.S. uses a progressive tax system with seven tax brackets ranging from 10% to 37%. Your W-4 form determines how much is withheld from each paycheck.
takeHomePay.ficaTaxesDesc: FICA (Federal Insurance Contributions Act) taxes fund Social Security and Medicare:
takeHomePay.medicareFicaDesc: 1.45% of all wages, plus an additional 0.9% on wages over $200,000 (single) or $250,000 (married)
takeHomePay.preTaxDeductionsDesc: Pre-tax deductions reduce your taxable income, lowering your tax burden:
takeHomePay.tipsTitle: Tips to Increase Take Home Pay
takeHomePay.tip4: Consider living in a state with no income tax
takeHomePay.tip5: Take advantage of commuter benefits if available
takeHomePay.footerDisclaimer: © 2026 FinCalc. For educational purposes only. Actual paycheck may vary based on additional factors.
takeHomePay.desc: Calculate your net pay after taxes and deductions.

selfEmploymentTax.title: Self-Employment Tax Calculator
selfEmploymentTax.description: Estimate self-employment taxes for freelancers and contractors.
selfEmploymentTax.pageDescription: Calculate your self-employment tax, income tax, and estimated quarterly payments
selfEmploymentTax.grossIncomeHelp: Total income from self-employment before expenses
selfEmploymentTax.head: Head of Household
selfEmploymentTax.otherIncomeHelp: Income from employment or other sources
selfEmploymentTax.retirementContributionHelp: SEP-IRA, Solo 401(k), or SIMPLE IRA contributions
selfEmploymentTax.healthInsuranceHelp: Health insurance premiums for you and your family
selfEmploymentTax.whatIsSeTaxText: Self-employment tax is the Social Security and Medicare tax for people who work for themselves. When you're an employee, your employer pays half of these taxes. When you're self-employed, you pay both halves - a total of 15.3%.
selfEmploymentTax.howCalculatedStep1: Calculate net self-employment income (gross income minus business expenses)
selfEmploymentTax.howCalculatedStep2: Multiply by 92.35% (this accounts for the employer-equivalent portion)
selfEmploymentTax.howCalculatedStep3: Apply 12.4% Social Security tax (up to $168,600 wage base)
selfEmploymentTax.howCalculatedStep5: Add 0.9% Additional Medicare Tax if over $200,000 (single) or $250,000 (married)
selfEmploymentTax.reducingTip1Desc: Every legitimate deduction reduces your taxable income
selfEmploymentTax.reducingTip2Desc: SEP-IRA allows up to 25% of net self-employment income
selfEmploymentTax.reducingTip3Desc: Self-employed individuals can deduct 100% of health insurance premiums
selfEmploymentTax.reducingTip4Desc: If you use part of your home exclusively for business
selfEmploymentTax.reducingTip5Desc: You can deduct the employer-equivalent portion from your income tax
selfEmploymentTax.estimatedPaymentsText: Self-employed individuals must make quarterly estimated tax payments if they expect to owe $1,000 or more in taxes. Failing to make these payments can result in penalties. Use Form 1040-ES to calculate and pay your estimated taxes.
selfEmploymentTax.recordKeepingText: Keep detailed records of all income and expenses. Save receipts, invoices, and bank statements. Good record keeping makes tax time easier and protects you in case of an audit.
selfEmploymentTax.footerDisclaimer: For educational purposes only. Consult a tax professional for personalized advice.
selfEmploymentTax.desc: Estimate self-employment taxes for freelancers and contractors.

refinance.title: Refinance Calculator
refinance.description: See if refinancing your mortgage could save you money.
refinance.articleIntro: Refinancing makes sense when you can lower your interest rate enough to offset closing costs within a reasonable timeframe.
refinance.guideline1: Rate reduction of at least 0.5-1% is typically worthwhile
refinance.guideline2: Plan to stay in the home long enough to reach break-even
refinance.guideline3: Consider shortening your term to build equity faster
refinance.guideline4: Factor in all closing costs, not just the rate
refinance.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This calculator provides estimates only. Consult a mortgage professional for accurate quotes.
refinance.desc: See if refinancing your mortgage could save you money.

rentVsBuy.title: Rent vs Buy Calculator
rentVsBuy.description: Compare the costs of renting versus buying a home.
rentVsBuy.pageDescription: Compare the total costs of renting versus buying a home over your expected time horizon.
rentVsBuy.rentAdvantage4: No risk of home value decline
rentVsBuy.desc: Compare the costs of renting versus buying a home.

homeAffordability.title: Home Affordability Calculator
homeAffordability.description: Find out how much house you can afford based on your income.
homeAffordability.pageDescription: Find out how much house you can afford based on your income and financial situation.
homeAffordability.articleTitle: How Much House Can You Afford?
homeAffordability.articleIntro: Lenders typically use two key ratios to determine how much you can borrow:
homeAffordability.rule28: Your housing costs should not exceed 28% of gross monthly income
homeAffordability.rule36: Total debt payments should not exceed 36% of gross monthly income
homeAffordability.tipsTitle: Tips for Buying Within Your Means
homeAffordability.tip1: Don't max out your budget - leave room for unexpected expenses
homeAffordability.tip2: Consider all costs: taxes, insurance, maintenance, HOA fees
homeAffordability.tip3: Save for a 20% down payment to avoid PMI
homeAffordability.desc: Find out how much house you can afford based on your income.

socialSecurity.title: Social Security Benefits Calculator
socialSecurity.description: Estimate your Social Security benefits at different ages.
socialSecurity.pageDescription: Estimate your Social Security retirement benefits based on your earnings and planned retirement age
socialSecurity.averageEarningsHint: Your average indexed monthly earnings will be calculated
socialSecurity.understandingEarlyDesc: Benefits reduced ~6.67% per year before FRA
socialSecurity.understandingDelayedDesc: Benefits increase 8% per year after FRA until 70
socialSecurity.understandingAIMEDesc: Average Indexed Monthly Earnings from highest 35 years
socialSecurity.resourcesDescription: Get accurate information from official sources:
socialSecurity.guideHowCalculatedText: Social Security benefits are based on your 35 highest-earning years. The Social Security Administration (SSA) calculates your Average Indexed Monthly Earnings (AIME) and applies a formula to determine your Primary Insurance Amount (PIA).
socialSecurity.guideWhenToClaimText: The decision of when to claim Social Security is personal and depends on factors like health, other income sources, and life expectancy. Claiming early provides income sooner but at a permanently reduced rate. Delaying until 70 maximizes your monthly benefit.
socialSecurity.guideWorkingDesc: If you claim before FRA and continue working, benefits may be temporarily reduced
socialSecurity.guideTaxationDesc: Up to 85% of benefits may be taxable depending on your total income
socialSecurity.guideSpousalDesc: You may be eligible for benefits based on your spouse's record
socialSecurity.guideSurvivorDesc: Your spouse may receive benefits based on your record after your death
socialSecurity.footerDisclaimer: For educational purposes only. Consult the SSA for official benefit estimates.
socialSecurity.desc: Estimate your Social Security benefits at different ages.

rothVsTraditional.title: Roth vs Traditional IRA Calculator
rothVsTraditional.description: Compare Roth and Traditional IRA to find the best option.
rothVsTraditional.pageDescription: Compare Roth and Traditional retirement accounts to determine which is better for your situation
rothVsTraditional.traditionalDesc: Tax deduction now, pay taxes on withdrawals
rothVsTraditional.rmdsDesc: Traditional has required minimum distributions at 73; Roth IRAs do not
rothVsTraditional.incomeLimitsDesc: Roth IRA has income limits; Traditional does not
rothVsTraditional.rothReason1: You expect higher taxes in retirement
rothVsTraditional.rothReason2: You're early in your career (lower tax bracket)
rothVsTraditional.traditionalReason1: You expect lower taxes in retirement
rothVsTraditional.traditionalReason2: You're in your peak earning years
rothVsTraditional.traditionalReason3: You need the tax deduction now
rothVsTraditional.taxTreatmentDesc: The fundamental difference between Roth and Traditional accounts is when you pay taxes. Traditional accounts give you a tax break today but you pay taxes on withdrawals. Roth accounts are funded with after-tax dollars but grow and can be withdrawn tax-free.
rothVsTraditional.taxRateQuestionDesc: The key factor in choosing between Roth and Traditional is comparing your current marginal tax rate to your expected tax rate in retirement. If you expect to be in a higher bracket in retirement, Roth is generally better. If you expect to be in a lower bracket, Traditional is usually better.
rothVsTraditional.taxDiversificationDesc: Many financial advisors recommend having both Roth and Traditional accounts for tax diversification. This gives you flexibility in retirement to manage your tax liability by choosing which accounts to withdraw from.
rothVsTraditional.rmdConsiderationDesc: Traditional accounts require RMDs starting at age 73; Roth IRAs do not
rothVsTraditional.earlyWithdrawalDesc: Roth contributions (not earnings) can be withdrawn penalty-free anytime
rothVsTraditional.estatePlanningDesc: Roth accounts can be more beneficial for heirs
rothVsTraditional.stateTaxesDesc: Consider your state's tax treatment of retirement income
rothVsTraditional.footerDisclaimer: © 2026 FinCalc. For educational purposes only. Consult a tax professional for personalized advice.
rothVsTraditional.desc: Compare Roth and Traditional IRA to find the best option.
rothVsTraditional.rothBetterDesc: Based on your inputs, a Roth account would provide {amount} more in after-tax retirement savings ({percent}% more).
rothVsTraditional.rothBetterReason: This is because your expected retirement tax rate ({retirementRate}%) is higher than or close to your current rate ({currentRate}%).
rothVsTraditional.traditionalBetterDesc: Based on your inputs, a Traditional account would provide {amount} more in after-tax retirement savings ({percent}% more).
rothVsTraditional.traditionalBetterReason: This is because your current tax rate ({currentRate}%) is higher than your expected retirement rate ({retirementRate}%).
rothVsTraditional.equalDesc: Based on your inputs, both Traditional and Roth accounts would provide similar after-tax retirement savings.
rothVsTraditional.equalAdvice: Consider other factors like tax diversification and flexibility.

loanPayoff.title: Loan Payoff Calculator
loanPayoff.desc: See how extra payments can help you pay off loans faster.

calc401k.title: 401(k) Calculator
calc401k.desc: Maximize your 401(k) contributions and employer matching.

blog.author: लेखक

newsletter.popupDescription: Get the latest financial tips, calculator updates, and exclusive content delivered to your inbox.
newsletter.inlineDescription: Join thousands of readers who receive our weekly financial insights and tips.
newsletter.footerTitle: Get Financial Tips in Your Inbox
newsletter.footerDescription: Subscribe to receive weekly tips on saving, investing, and managing your money.
newsletter.widgetDescription: Get weekly financial tips and updates.

download.title: Get the Desktop App
download.description: Use FinCalc offline with our desktop application. All calculators, no internet required.
download.successDescription: Your download links are ready. Choose your platform below.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: FinCalc ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information when you visit our website.

informationProvide.title: Information You Provide
informationProvide.content: Our calculators process financial information you enter (such as loan amounts, interest rates, income figures). This information is processed entirely in your browser and is never sent to our servers. We do not store, collect, or have access to any financial data you enter into our calculators.

autoCollected.title: Automatically Collected Information
autoCollected.content: When you visit our website, we may automatically collect certain information, including:

howWeUse.title: How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.content: We use automatically collected information to:
howWeUse.item1: Analyze website traffic and usage patterns
howWeUse.item2: Improve our calculators and user experience

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.content: We use essential cookies to ensure our website functions properly.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.content: We use Google Analytics to understand how visitors interact with our website. Google Analytics uses cookies to collect anonymous information about your visits. You can opt out of Google Analytics by installing the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on.

advertising.title: Advertising Cookies
advertising.content: We use Google AdSense to display advertisements. Google and its partners may use cookies to serve ads based on your prior visits to our website or other websites. You can opt out of personalized advertising by visiting Google Ads Settings.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: Our website uses the following third-party services:
thirdParty.analytics: Google Analytics: For website analytics (Privacy Policy)
thirdParty.adsense: Google AdSense: For displaying advertisements (Privacy Policy)
thirdParty.fonts: Google Fonts: For typography (Privacy Policy)

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your information. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our website is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.content: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, including:
yourRights.item1: The right to access your personal information
yourRights.item2: The right to request deletion of your personal information
yourRights.item3: The right to opt out of certain data processing

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using FinCalc ("the Website"), you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our website.

description.title: Description of Service
description.content: FinCalc provides free online financial calculators for educational and informational purposes. Our calculators include mortgage calculators, loan calculators, investment calculators, retirement planners, and tax estimators.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: IMPORTANT: The calculators and information provided on this website are for general informational and educational purposes only. They are not intended to provide financial, tax, legal, or investment advice.
disclaimer.item1: Results are estimates only and may not reflect actual outcomes
disclaimer.item2: Tax laws and financial regulations vary by jurisdiction and change frequently
disclaimer.item3: Individual circumstances vary and may affect actual results
disclaimer.item4: Always consult with qualified professionals (financial advisors, tax professionals, attorneys) before making financial decisions

noAdvice.title: No Professional Advice
noAdvice.content: Nothing on this website constitutes professional financial, tax, legal, or investment advice. The use of our calculators does not create a professional-client relationship. You should not rely solely on the information provided by our calculators when making financial decisions.

accuracy.title: Accuracy of Information
accuracy.content: While we strive to provide accurate and up-to-date information, we make no warranties or representations about the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of any information on this website. Tax rates, contribution limits, and other financial data may change and may not be immediately updated on our website.

risk.title: Use at Your Own Risk
risk.content: Your use of this website and its calculators is at your own risk. We are not responsible for any decisions you make based on the information or calculations provided by our website.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: To the fullest extent permitted by law, FinCalc and its owners, operators, and affiliates shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from:
liability.item1: Your use of or inability to use the website
liability.item2: Any errors or omissions in the content
liability.item3: Any decisions made based on information from our calculators
liability.item4: Any unauthorized access to or use of our servers

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.content: All content on this website, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is the property of FinCalc and is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our express written permission.

conduct.title: User Conduct
conduct.item1: Use the website for any unlawful purpose
conduct.item2: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
conduct.item3: Interfere with the proper functioning of the website
conduct.item4: Use automated systems to access the website without permission

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Links
thirdParty.content: Our website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the content, privacy practices, or terms of service of these external sites.

modifications.title: Modifications
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting. Your continued use of the website after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.

governing.title: Governing Law
governing.content: These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the United States, without regard to conflict of law principles.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at:
